about.name: Manchester
about.info_text: Manchester is a dynamic and diverse city located in the northwest of England. It is known for its rich industrial heritage, world-class music scene, and thriving cultural and sporting life. The city offers a blend of history and innovation, with impressive architecture, museums, and galleries alongside modern developments. With a warm and friendly atmosphere, Manchester welcomes visitors with open arms and provides a unique and vibrant urban experience.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 547,627
County: Greater Manchester
Time Zone: Greenwich Mean Time (UTC+00:00)
Language: English
Currency: British Pound (GBP)
about.climate_text: Manchester has a temperate maritime climate with cool summers and mild winters. Rainfall is evenly distributed throughout the year, so it's a good idea to be prepared for occasional showers.

attractions_card.title: Old Trafford
attractions_card.description: Old Trafford is the legendary stadium of Manchester United Football Club and a must-visit for football enthusiasts. Take a stadium tour and explore the club's rich history.

attractions_card.title: The John Rylands Library
attractions_card.description: The John Rylands Library is a stunning neo-Gothic library that houses an extensive collection of rare books, manuscripts, and archives. It's a paradise for book lovers.

attractions_card.title: Manchester Town Hall
attractions_card.description: Manchester Town Hall is an architectural masterpiece, showcasing Victorian Gothic design. Visitors can admire its impressive clock tower and stunning interiors.

attractions_card.title: The Lowry
attractions_card.description: The Lowry is an arts and entertainment complex that hosts theaters, galleries, and a range of performances, from drama to ballet.

attractions_card.title: Science and Industry Museum
attractions_card.description: This museum celebrates Manchester's industrial heritage and technological innovations. It's an engaging and educational experience for all ages.

attractions_card.title: Manchester Art Gallery
attractions_card.description: The Manchester Art Gallery features a diverse collection of art, from pre-Raphaelite masterpieces to contemporary works.

attractions_card.title: Chinatown
attractions_card.description: Manchester's Chinatown is a bustling hub of restaurants, shops, and cultural events. It's a great place to savor Chinese cuisine and experience traditional festivals.

attractions_card.title: Castlefield Urban Heritage Park
attractions_card.description: Castlefield is a historic area with canals, Roman ruins, and well-preserved industrial architecture, offering a glimpse into Manchester's past.

food_card.title: Full English Breakfast
food_card.description: A hearty breakfast that includes eggs, bacon, sausage, black pudding, beans, tomatoes, and toast. It's a traditional British morning meal.

food_card.title: Manchester Tart
food_card.description: A classic dessert featuring a shortcrust pastry base, raspberry jam, custard, and a topping of desiccated coconut. It's a local favorite.

food_card.title: Bury Black Pudding
food_card.description: Black pudding is a type of blood sausage, and the Bury variety is a celebrated regional delicacy. It's often served with breakfast.

food_card.title: Lancashire Hotpot
food_card.description: A comforting dish made with lamb or beef, potatoes, onions, and a savory gravy. It's slow-cooked to perfection.

food_card.title: Manchester Egg
food_card.description: A unique twist on the Scotch egg, the Manchester Egg features a pickled egg wrapped in sausage meat and breadcrumbs.

hotels_card.title: The Midland Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Midland is a historic and elegant hotel in the heart of Manchester, known for its luxury accommodations and exquisite dining.

hotels_card.title: Radisson Blu Edwardian Manchester
hotels_card.description: This stylish hotel offers contemporary rooms and a prime location near major attractions and shopping areas.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Gotham
hotels_card.description: Hotel Gotham is a boutique hotel with a distinctive Art Deco design, providing a unique and upscale experience in the city.

hotels_card.title: King Street Townhouse
hotels_card.description: A charming boutique hotel with a rooftop terrace, offering panoramic views of Manchester's skyline and excellent hospitality.

hotels_card.title: INNSiDE by Meliá Manchester
hotels_card.description: A modern and trendy hotel with stylish rooms and a welcoming atmosphere, perfect for business and leisure travelers.

transport_card.title: Manchester Metrolink
transport_card.description: The Metrolink is Manchester's tram system, offering efficient public transportation throughout the city and to surrounding areas.

transport_card.title: Manchester Piccadilly Station
transport_card.description: Manchester Piccadilly is the main railway station in the city, connecting Manchester to other major cities in the UK.

transport_card.title: Manchester Airport
transport_card.description: Manchester Airport is the largest international airport in the region, providing air travel options to various destinations worldwide.

transport_card.title: Bus Services
transport_card.description: Manchester has an extensive bus network, making it easy to navigate the city and its suburbs by bus.
